item.title: Flytip on Whittington Road, 14th June
item.description:
The location is the Whittington Road about 1/4 mile past the Burnt Oak Crossroads and just past the Cattle barn on the left hand side. The flytip is on the right hand side in a space used as a passing place and consists of about 6 Black Sacks and other rubbish. Please can it be cleared up.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerously missing Give Way road markings., 14th June
item.description:
Additional new lane, with different surface colour, and worn Give Way junction markers give false impression that the end of Bamfurlong lane is further than it is. This makes it likely vehicles overshoot the junction risking a side on collision with traffic on the main B4063 carriage way. I have recently sampled and observed vehicles turning right onto the main carriage. Half of them that needed to stop overshot the junction by nearly a wheel length. I have even seen exasperated people pointing to the new tarmac explaining to their passengers that they thought that was were the main road started!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 23 Bamfurlong Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bollard taken out on Liddington Road, 13th June
item.description:
There is a bollard lying on the path in Liddington Road. It's come out of the footpath and there is a deep hole in the path. The bollard needs cementing back into the ground.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 21 Liddington Road, Elmbridge
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavements + potholes in Insley Gardens need repairing., 13th June
item.description:
The above says it all. This needs to be sorted out.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 52 Insley Gardens, Hucclecote

item.title: Side of Narrow Road Badly Eroded, 13th June
item.description:
The location is up Ham Hill on the left hand side where water from the spring that has come down the hill has badly eroded the side. A neighbour has asked this be reported as it is would be dangerous if two vehicles tried to pass at the poit - the drop off the road is estimated at up to 2 feet. Please can this be repaired as soon as possible.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Ham Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Small Fly Tip at Location, 13th June
item.description:
The location is on the Ags Hill to Burnt Oak Crossroads and about 100 yards before the Cotswolds Way Footpath on the right hand side in a passing place / field entrance. A plastic bin has been dumped there and there may be other material. Please can it be cleared away before it attracts other material.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vegetation growing onto road., 12th June
item.description:
Large amounts of vegetation are steadily spreading onto Lynworth Place from the green. Green maintained fine but road vegetation not cleared. Similar issues with neighbours footpaths around the park.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 24 Lynworth Place, Cheltenham

item.title: Lynworth Place - Significant road deterioration, 12th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 24 Lynworth Place, Cheltenham

item.title: Road is covered in entrails, 11th June

Obnoxious smell

item.title: Metal cover in the middle of the road is loose and makes a loud clanking noise everytime it is driven over. Needs fixing, 11th June
item.description:
There is a large metal cover in the middle of Folly Lane, opposite the entrance to Festival Way and outside number 18 Folly Lane. It is loose and every time a vehicle goes over it it makes a loud ker-clunk noise. Hundreds of times a day/night. It is disturbing peoples sleep especially in this hot weather. It needs fixing so it does not cause noise every time it is driven over.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 16b Folly Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned temporary road sign and sandbag fallen over and causing trip/injury hazard, 11th June
item.description:
A mental temporary road sign and sand bag has fallen over onto its front, causing its metal legs to stick out and present an injury hazard to pedestrians. It has been this was for about 2 weeks, maybe longer. It needs to be removed assuming it is no longer needed. It is on the pavement outside number 32 Evesham Road, Cheltenham GL52 2AB

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 32 Evesham Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous rocks, 11th June
item.description:
Resident of 93 hawthorn road has placed large rocks outside the property that one of my children tripped over. They are inherently dangerous

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 93 Hawthorn Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
